page.title: 12A local shop
page.content: Mr. Wadsworth owns the local self-service grocery shop. It is in a row of four shops in the main village street. He sells fruit, salad vegetables, cooked meats and general groceries. He gets his stock delivered daily from wholesalers. His busiest day is Saturday. His best selling item is potatoes. He has got two storerooms, one for dry and smelly goods and one for packet and tinned goods. He opens his shop at 8.00am. and closes at 5.30pm. and has a one hour lunch break. He has three assistants who work with him. His takings are Â£2,000 per week, one quarter of which he takes on Saturday.
